question: Neil Armstrong was the first person to reach on the moon. While walking on the moon what happens to his mass and weight?
option1: His mass remained the same but weight increased
option2: His mass remained the same but weight decreased
option3: His mass as well as weight decreased
option4: His mass increased but weight remained the same
answer: His mass remained the same but weight decreased
explanation: Mass is a measure of the amount of matter that an object has, or how much “stuff” it is made up of. Weight is a measure of how much gravity pulls on a mass or object. Mass doesn\'t change when gravity changes. The mass on the moon would be the same as the mass on earth. The force due to gravity is 1/6 that of Earth, so he will weigh 1/6 of Earth weight.
